title: Drawing, "Sketches for an altar"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d and 457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. At right: an altar furniture with above the tabernacle, with a slightly altered design of the right tone in -1375. The angels support also brackets as in -1375, left. Outlines of the back of the framing. Above, at left, a sketch of the altar, seen from its left corner. Pen. At left, below, a sketch of the mensa with the sepulchrum, in the shape of a reliquary box; pen, brush. Written in the lower right corner, vertically: "56".

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketches for an altar".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1390.
